overview: In Tulle (France) on June 9, 1944, 99 men are hanged on the balconies of the city and 149 are deported. This crime was perpetrated by elements of the 2nd Armored Division SS Das Reich. The next day, this same division massacred the inhabitants of the village of Oradour-sur-Glane. Patrick SÃ©raudie goes to meet the families of victims and deportees and the few witnesses of the tragedy to collect a word so long buried.
title: Le silence et la douleur
